edu.indiana.cs.c212.players

Interface Player

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPlayer, BasicTrailsPlayer, CommandLinePlayer, PointAndClickPlayer, SimpleRandom

    public interface Player
    A player is a class that defines a contract that allows any implementing class to participate in the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      edu.indiana.cs.c212.gameMechanics.PlayerColor getColor()
      This method returns the color of this player, usually RED or BLUE
      edu.indiana.cs.c212.gameMechanics.Move getMove(edu.indiana.cs.c212.board.Board board, java.util.List<edu.indiana.cs.c212.gameMechanics.Move> legalMoves)
      This method is the entry point for a Player.
      java.lang.String getName() 

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        edu.indiana.cs.c212.gameMechanics.PlayerColor getColor()
        This method returns the color of this player, usually RED or BLUE
        Returns:
        the PlayerColor of this player

      • getMove

        edu.indiana.cs.c212.gameMechanics.Move getMove(edu.indiana.cs.c212.board.Board board,
                                               java.util.List<edu.indiana.cs.c212.gameMechanics.Move> legalMoves)
        This method is the entry point for a Player. A player will be invoked with the getMove() method and given a copy of the board and the list of legal moves from the GameRunner. It is then expected to return a Move from the list of legalMoves. If it does not do so it will forfeit. Which move is chosen varies from Player to Player depending on their strategy.
        Parameters:
        board -
        legalMoves -
        Returns:
        a Move representing the desired action of this Player

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the String that this player wants to be called
